detail.content: Fundamentals of Audio Workstations II: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Recorded Music Program Courses Internships News & Events Facilities Alumni Faculty Directory Recorded Music FAQs For High School Students Facebook Twitter YouTube Summer In Recorded Music Academic Advisement Resources 194 Recordings  home > Recorded Music        Fundamentals of Audio Workstations II  REMU-UT.1021 Required Production 2 Credits Instructor(s): Staff This course is required, offered Spring only. Recorded Music majors only. Prerequisite: REMU-UT 1020 Fundamentals of Audio Workstations I, with a grade of C or better. Note: There is a lab fee for this course. In this course, students will acquire an in-depth, theoretical and practical knowledge of Digital Audio Workstations using the industry standard LogicPro software through a weekly, lab-based workshop. Each class meeting will be a combination of lecture and immediate application. An emphasis will be placed on getting to know Logic, getting inside Logic, creating sessions, working with media in sessions, audio recording, audio editing, file management techniques, MIDI recording, editing techniques, mixing techniques, backups and stereo mix-down. Fundamentals of Audio Workstations I: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Recorded Music Program Courses Internships News & Events Facilities Alumni Faculty Directory Recorded Music FAQs For High School Students Facebook Twitter YouTube Summer In Recorded Music Academic Advisement Resources 194 Recordings  home > Recorded Music        Fundamentals of Audio Workstations I  REMU-UT.1020 Required Production 2 Credits Instructor(s): Bo Pericic This course is required, offered Fall only. Recorded Music majors only. Prerequisite: None. Note: There is a lab fee for this course. In this course, students will acquire an in-depth, theoretical and practical knowledge of Digital Audio Workstations using the industry standard ProTools software through a weekly, lab-based workshop. Each class will be a combination of lecture and immediate application. An emphasis will be placed on getting to know ProTools, getting inside ProTools, creating sessions, working with media in sessions, audio recording, audio editing, file management techniques, MIDI recording, editing techniques, mixing techniques, backups and stereo mix-down. There is a lab fee for this course. Computer Workstation Packages, AS | NYU                                                 Navigation       Arts and Science 2015                 About Arts and Science | Departments and Programs | The Faculty       About Arts and Science | Departments and Programs | Our Faculty                  Back to Home             Computer Workstation Packages   The following are the current FAS/CIT recommended configurations for workstations. The machine configurations are based on the NYU standards for computers. Replacement/New machines may be chosen from the Standard PC Workstation, Standard PC Laptop, Standard Mac Workstation, or Standard Mac Laptops. Any upgrades beyond the standard configurations must be paid with departmental or research funds. Standard PC Workstation - All-in-One Option This workstation is intended for the PC user. It has the computer built into the back of the monitor, like an Apple iMac, and takes a smaller amount of desk space. Dell Optiplex 9030 AIO with camera, Intel Quad-Core i5 4590S Quad-Core Processor 3.0GHz, 6M Cache, Integrated Gigabit NIC, Intel integrated Graphics VGA/HDMI and Integrated Sound. 8GB 1600MHz RAM, 500GB SATA Hard Drive, 8X DVD+/-RW. 23" Widescreen WLED Display. Windows 7 Professional 64-bit. 4 year warranty Microsoft Office Professional installed separately by FAS/CIT support providers, as appropriate under license agreement (Select licensing allows installation on one desktop and one laptop per individual). Wired mouse and keyboard.  PC Laptop This laptop is intended for typical laptop users. Dell Latitude E7440 with Core i7-4600U Processor 2.1GHz. 8GB RAM, 500GB Hard Drive, No DVD drive. Built-in camera and microphone. No Modem, Integrated Network Card, and Wireless 802.11n card. 14.0" HD Anti-Glare WLED-backlit Display. Windows 7 Professional 64-bit. Microsoft Office 2010 Professional installed separately by FAS/CIT support providers, as appropriate under license agreement (Select licensing allows installation on one office computer and one laptop per individual). Standard Apple Workstation This workstation is intended for the Macintosh user.  iMac with Intel Quad-Core i5 2.7GHz processor, Built-in Facetime HD camera, sound and Gigabit NIC. 8GB RAM, 1TB Hard Drive, Intel IRIS Pro graphics. 21.5" Display, Airport Extreme 802.11ac, Bluetooth 4.0. 2 Thunderbolt ports, 4 USB 3.0 ports, SDXC card slot, Mini DisplayPort output with support for DVI, VGA, and dual-link DVI. Wired keyboard, Wired Mouse. MacOS 10.9, AppleCare three-year protection plan. Microsoft Office 2011 Professional installed separately by FAS/CIT support providers, as appropriate under license agreement (Select licensing allows installation on one office computer and one laptop per individual). Please note, if the MacBook Air breaks down in the 4th year of its life, I will require a prorated amount of funding for accelerated replacement. Apple Laptop – MacBook Pro 13" with Retina Display Apple MacBook Dual-Core i5 2.6GHz processor. 8GB 1333MHz RAM, 256GB Flash Storage, Intel Iris graphics, Gigabit Ethernet. 13.3" LED-backlit glossy widescreen Display with IPS technology, no modem, Wi-fi 802.11ac, Bluetooth 4.0. Built-in FaceTime HD camera, microphone, and speakers. 2 Thunderbolt, 2 USB 3.0 ports, SDXC card slot, HDMI port. (3.5 pounds) MacOS 10.9, AppleCare three-year protection plan. Microsoft Office 2011 Professional installed separately by FAS/CIT support providers, as appropriate under license agreement (Select licensing allows installation on two computers per individual).  Apple Laptop – MacBook Air 13" Apple MacBook Dual-Core i5 1.4GHz processor. 4GB 1333MHz RAM, 256GB Hard Drive, Intel HD 5000 graphics, Gigabit Ethernet. 13.3" LED-backlit glossy widescreen Display, no modem, Wi-fi 802.11ac, Bluetooth 4.0. Built-in FaceTime HD camera, microphone, and speakers. 1 Thunderbolt, SDXC card slot, 2 USB ports. (3 pounds) MacOS 10.9, AppleCare three-year protection plan. Microsoft Office 2011 Professional installed separately by FAS/CIT support providers, as appropriate under license agreement (Select licensing allows installation on two computers per individual). Faculty and staff printers are replaced on an as-needed basis, with a new one provided for new faculty. An upgrade to the printer is available if department or research funds are used to pay for the difference. The standard printer configuration is given below: HP Laserjet P1102w HP Laserjet P1102w printer. 6' USB Cable.
